results.title: Freedom
results.creator_credit: Bob Gatherum, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: During his trip back to Normandy on the 65th anniversary of D-day, Bob Gatherum reflects on the lasting legacy of war. Travelling through Normandy, he was surprised and amazed at the appreciation shown by the local people whose freedom he and his fellow soldiers had helped protect.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Gatherum, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: AFL: I'd like to see that [advertisement] 1994
results.brief_description: Produced in 1994 to promote Australian Rules Football as a national game, this ad features international sportspeople Evander Holyfeld (boxer), Hakeem ‘The Dream’ Olajuwon (basketball player), Carl Lewis (runner), Sharron Davies (swimmer), John McEnroe (tennis player), Dean Richards (rugby player) and Ian Wright (soccer player). Produced by Campaign Palace.
results.description: Produced in 1994 to promote Australian Rules Football as a national game, this ad features international sportspeople Evander Holyfeld (boxer), Hakeem ‘The Dream’ Olajuwon (basketball player), Carl Lewis (runner), Sharron Davies (swimmer), John McEnroe (tennis player), Dean Richards (rugby player) and Ian Wright (soccer player). results.title: Love My Way: Garden of Love
results.creator_credit: Claudia Karvan, John Edwards, Jessica Hobbs, Fiona Seres, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime, Foxtel and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description:
The groundbreaking, multiple award-winning drama series ‘Love My Way’ was one of the first Australian productions made exclusively for subscription television (Foxtel). This enabled Foxtel to allow the producers ‘absolute creative freedom…to carve out a piece of TV drama that was edgy, daring, provocative’ (Foxtel’s Brian Walsh).

Revolving around the untidy lives and complicated loves of a contemporary Australian blended family and their friends, ‘Love My Way’ was both critically acclaimed and highly successful, with a further two seasons produced following the initial ten episodes of Series 1.

Series 1, Episode 10 first aired on Foxtel on 31st January 2005.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Claudia Karvan, John Edwards, Jessica Hobbs, Fiona Seres, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime, Foxtel and Southern Star Entertainment

group_siblings.title: Love My Way: What's In a Name

results.title: Love My Way: Spin Cycle
results.creator_credit: Claudia Karvan, John Edwards, Ian Watson, Brendan Cowell, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime, Foxtel and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description:
The groundbreaking, multiple award-winning drama series ‘Love My Way’ was one of the first Australian productions made exclusively for subscription television (Foxtel). This enabled Foxtel to allow the producers ‘absolute creative freedom…to carve out a piece of TV drama that was edgy, daring, provocative’ (Foxtel’s Brian Walsh).

Revolving around the untidy lives and complicated loves of a contemporary Australian blended family and their friends, ‘Love My Way’ was both critically acclaimed and highly successful, with a further two seasons produced following the initial ten episodes of Series 1.

Series 1, Episode 4 first aired on Foxtel on 6th December 2004.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Claudia Karvan, John Edwards, Ian Watson, Brendan Cowell, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime, Foxtel and Southern Star Entertainment

results.title: Triptych
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Walter Bird and ACMI
results.brief_description: Walter Bird recalls a time when he was asked “Where are you from?”, and answered by describing where his house was situated in the neighbourhood. Growing up, he started to learn the implications of that question. He realised that he was ethnically different from other Australian-born children. Being the child of immigrants, Walter weighs up the positives and negatives of being a first generation Australian and shares his experiences when he finally travelled to his parents’ countries.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Walter Bird and ACMI
